name: OATP inhibition can increase exposure of OATP substrates
actions: Consider interaction risk when combining OATP inhibitors with OATP substrates (educational).
If used together, monitor for dose-related adverse effects of the affected drug.
Recognize that uptake transporter effects can be substrate- and dose-dependent.

rationale: {B_name} inhibits hepatic uptake transport (OATP), which can reduce hepatic clearance of {A_name}.
Reduced uptake into the liver can increase systemic exposure of some OATP substrates.

explanation_template: {B_name} inhibits OATP transport and {A_name} is an OATP substrate. This may increase {A_name} exposure, raising the risk of dose-related adverse effects.

references.citation: Mechanistic pattern: uptake transporter inhibition can increase exposure of certain substrates.
